sub_topic: Determining the bond enthalpy of a molecule
message_1: What is the bond enthalpy of the carbon-carbon double bond (C=C) in ethene (C2H4) when 120 kJ/mol of energy is required to break the bond?
message_2: The bond enthalpy of the carbon-carbon double bond (C=C) in ethene (C2H4) is the amount of energy required to break the bond. In this case, it is given that 120 kJ/mol of energy is required to break the bond. Therefore, the bond enthalpy of the C=C bond in ethene is 120 kJ/mol.
